column4: Retail stocks up after strong holiday weekend
column5: After a blockbuster performance over the long Thanksgiving weekend  risk-taking retailers such as Macy's Inc  and Amazon.com Inc  were rewarded with big gains in their shares  while chains that are still tinkering with their strategies reaped smaller rewards. |Â Video

column4: Amazon Kindle sales heat up  stock jumps
column5: Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it saw a surge in sales of its Kindle devices  helped by its new Kindle Fire tablet  on the crucial "Black Friday" shopping day after Thanksgiving.

column4: UPDATE 2-Amazon says Kindle sales surge on Black Friday
column5: Nov 28 Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it saw a surge in sales of its Kindle devices  helped by its new Kindle Fire tablet  on the crucial "Black Friday" shopping day after Thanksgiving.

column4: Amazon says Kindle sales surge on Black Friday
column5: Nov 28 Amazon.com Inc said on Monday that it saw a surge in sales of its Kindle devices  helped by its new Kindle Fire tablet  on the crucial "Black Friday" shopping day after Thanksgiving.

column4: Black Friday online sales jump 26 percent: comScore
column5: Online retail sales in the United States on the post-Thanksgiving shopping day known as "Black Friday" jumped 26 percent this year  led by Amazon.com Inc  comScore said on Sunday.

column4: REFILE-Black Friday online sales jump 26 pct - comScore
column5: Nov 27 Online retail sales in the United States  on the post-Thanksgiving shopping day known as "Black Friday"  jumped 26 percent this year  led by Amazon.com Inc   comScore said on Sunday.

column4: Apple beats Android in British market in October
column5: The long-awaited iPhone 4S launch helped Apple Inc  take top spot in the British smartphone market in October  overtaking phones using Google Inc's  Android platform  data from research firm Kantar Worldpanel ComTech showed on Monday.

column4: Apple beats Android in Britain in Oct-researcher
column5: Nov 28 The long-awaited iPhone 4S launch helped Apple Inc take top spot in the British smartphone market in October  overtaking phones using Google Inc's Android platform  data from research firm Kantar Worldpanel ComTech showed on Monday.

column4: Google seeks EU approval for Motorola Mobility deal
column5: BRUSSELS  Nov 28 World No. 1 Internet search engine Google is seeking EU regulatory clearance of its planned purchase of handset maker Motorola Mobility Holdings  the European Commission said on its website on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Progress Software appoints new CEO
column5: Nov 28 Business software maker Progress Software Corp appointed Jay Bhatt as its chief executive officer effective Dec. 5.

column4: Baidu to invest 3 billion yuan to help Chinese SMEs
column5: SHANGHAI China's largest search engine Baidu Inc said on Monday it will invest 3 billion yuan ($470.6 million) by the end of 2015 to help 2 million small- and medium-sized enterprises expand their businesses.

column4: Baidu to invest 3 bln yuan to help Chinese SMEs
column5: SHANGHAI  Nov 28 China's largest search engine Baidu Inc said on Monday it will invest 3 billion yuan ($470.6 million) by the end of 2015 to help 2 million small- and medium-sized enterprises expand their businesses.

column4: Struggling ST-Ericsson replaces CEO
column5: Loss-making mobile chip venture ST-Ericsson said on Monday its operations chief Didier Lamouche would replace its Chief Executive Gilles Delfassy from the start of December.

column4: UPDATE 1-Struggling ST-Ericsson replaces CEO
column5: Nov 28 Loss-making mobile chip venture ST-Ericsson said on Monday its operations chief Didier Lamouche would replace its Chief Executive Gilles Delfassy from the start of December.

column4: UPDATE 2-Randgold cuts 2011 output target after Tongon problems
column5: LONDON  Nov 28 West Africa-focused miner Randgold Resources has cut its 2011 production target for the second time this year after a "perfect storm" of difficult mining conditions  work stoppages and a mill breakdown at its Tongon mine in Ivory Coast.

column4: RPT-BAY STREET-Banks may end 2011  start 2012  with a whimper
column5: TORONTO  Nov 27 A volatile year for Canadian banking results is likely to end on a soft note  and the outlook for 2012 won't inspire confidence as Europe's debt troubles deepen and Canadian borrowers turn shy.

column4: Russia's Yandex buys mobile software firm
column5: Nov 28 Russian search engine Yandex NV  has bought mobile software company SPB Software as it looks for ways to partner with mobile firms and give phone users easy access to its search function  the company said on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 4-Anadarko ups Mozambique gas reserves again
column5: LONDON  Nov 28 U.S. oil company Anadarko Petroleum Corp said its major gas finds offshore Mozambique were around twice as large as it earlier thought  adding support to hopes that East Africa will become another major gas production centre.

column4: UPDATE 2-Anadarko ups Mozambique gas reserves again
column5: LONDON  Nov 28 U.S. oil company Anadarko Petroleum said its major gas finds offshore Mozambique were actually twice as large as it earlier thought  adding support to hopes that East Africa will become another major gas production centre.

column4: Assured Guaranty files new claims against JPMorgan
column5: NEW YORK Bond insurer Assured Guaranty Ltd filed new claims against JPMorgan Chase & Co over a mortgage-backed security sold by Bear Stearns  saying more than 35 witnesses have come forward to testify about how loans in the $337 million transaction were misrepresented.

column4: Court delays AT&T merger hearing
column5: The judge hearing the Justice Department's challenge of AT&T Inc's plan to buy Deutsche Telekom AG's T-Mobile USA unit has postponed a status conference set for this week until early December  the court said in an order issued on Monday.

column4: UPDATE 1-Court delays AT&T merger hearing
column5: Nov 28 The judge hearing the Justice Department's challenge of AT&T Inc's plan to buy Deutsche Telekom AG's T-Mobile USA unit has postponed a status conference set for this week until early December  the court said in an order issued on Monday.

column4: US STOCKS-Wall St set to jump at open on euro zone hopes
column5: NEW YORK  Nov 28 U.S. stocks were set for a sharply higher open on Monday on hopes that fresh proposals could be emerging out of Europe to help solve the region's debt crisis.

column4: U.S. holiday weekend sales surge  Best Buy a winner
column5: NEW YORK U.S. retailers racked up a record $52.4 billion in sales over the Thanksgiving weekend  a 16.4 percent jump from a year ago  as early hours and attractive promotions brought out more shoppers  an industry trade group said on Sunday.

column4: UPDATE 2-BHP Billiton CFO to quit  top pool expands
column5: MELBOURNE  Nov 28 BHP Billiton   announced the surprise retirement of its popular chief financial officer  Alex Vanselow  and expanded its top management committee on Monday  building on the team of potential successors to its young chief executive.

column4: BlackRock  Deutsche top insurance asset list
column5: Nov 28 BlackRock and Deutsche Bank topped the list of asset managers for the insurance industry in 2010  together managing nearly five times their closest competitor  according to a new survey released on Monday.

column4: Russia Transneft hikes fines for below par oil load
column5: MOSCOW  Nov 28 Russia's oil pipeline operator Transneft will substantially increase fines for lower than agreed volumes loaded into its network  a company spokesman told Reuters on Monday.

column4: RPT-UPDATE 4-Cameco clears way for Rio's C$654 mln Hathor deal
column5: TORONTO  Nov 28 Cameco Corp has backed out of a bidding war for Hathor  clearing the way for Rio Tinto's C$654 million friendly offer and sending shares of the Canadian uranium explorer tumbling.

column4: UPDATE 4-Cameco clears way for Rio's C$654 mln Hathor deal
column5: TORONTO  Nov 28 Cameco Corp has backed out of a bidding war for Hathor   clearing the way for Rio Tinto's C$654 million friendly offer and sending shares of the Canadian uranium explorer tumbling.

column4: Cameco quits Hathor race  leaving Rio's C$654 million bid
column5: TORONTO Cameco Corp  said on Monday it is backing out of a bidding war for Hathor   after Anglo-Australian miner Rio Tinto  sweetened its bid for the Canadian uranium explorer to C$654 million.

column5: WASHINGTON  Nov 28 Chevron Corp will brief U.S. offshore drilling regulators on its recent oil spill off the coast of Brazil  an agency official said on Monday.

column5: NEW YORK A federal judge angrily threw out Citigroup Inc's proposed $285 million settlement over the sale of toxic mortgage debt  excoriating the top U.S. market regulator over how it reaches corporate fraud settlements.

column4: Clear Channel says outdoor ads resist crisis
column5: LONDON/PARIS Outdoor advertising is proving surprisingly resilient amid Europe's debt crisis  although many companies are still wavering before committing to ad budgets for next year  the head of the international arm of Clear Channel Outdoor Holdings Inc said.

column4: CNOOC wraps up Opti deal to expand in oil sands
column5: Nov 28 CNOOC Ltd closed its C$2.1 billion ($2.04 billion) acquisition of Opti Canada Ltd  on Monday  giving China's top offshore oil company its second stake in a Canadian oil sands property.

column4: Icahn plans Commercial Metals buy; investors skeptical
column5: Carl Icahn offered to buy out Commercial Metals Co  in a deal valuing the metals recycler at $1.73 billion  but investors remained skeptical over the billionaire investor's poor record in closing acquisitions this year.

column4: Deals of the day -- mergers and acquisitions
column5: Nov 28 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals involving European  U.S. and Asian companies were reported by 2100 GMT on Monday.

column4: Delek reports FCCU boiler back at Tyler refinery
column5: Nov 28 Delek U.S. Holdings said on Monday normal operations were restored in a gasoline-making fluid catalytic cracker unit (FCCU) CO boiler after a snag at its 60 000 barrel-per-day Tyler  Texas  refinery  according to a filing with state pollution regulators.

column4: Delta says union rejection upheld
column5: Delta Air Lines Inc said on Monday that U.S. labor mediators rejected claims of interference that were filed by the machinists union after workers at the airline's TechOps plane maintenance department voted against unionizing.

column4: Europe  politics weigh on US hiring outlook-survey
column5: Nov 28 More U.S. employers are curtailing hiring plans than six months ago because Europe's economic problems are affecting their confidence about the U.S. economy  according to a twice-yearly survey by Dice Holdings Inc .

column4: Text-Fitch rates DTE Energy's $280 mln jnr sub debs BB+
column5: NEW YORK  November 28 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has assigned a rating of 'BB+' to DTE Energy Company's (DTE  IDR 'BBB' by Fitch) $280 million issuance of 6.5% Junior Subordinated  debentures  2011 Series I  due Dec. 1  2061. The Junior Subordinated debentures rank junior to other unsecured debt of DTE. Proceeds from the issuance will be used to retire $280 million of outstanding Trust Preferred securities  comprised of $180 million of 7.8% Trust Preferred securities due 2032 and $100 million of 7.5%

column4: GM offers Volt owners loaner cars during probe
column5: DETROIT General Motors Co said on Monday that it will offer loaner vehicles to more than 5 000 owners of its Chevrolet Volt as it works with U.S. safety regulators on ways to reduce the risk of fires breaking out days after crashes involving the electric car.

column4: UPDATE 2-GM offers Volt owners loaner cars during probe
column5: DETROIT  Nov 28 General Motors Co said on Monday that it will offer loaner vehicles to more than 5 000 owners of its Chevrolet Volt as it works with U.S. safety regulators on ways to reduce the risk of fires breaking out days after crashes involving the electric car.

column4: French court annuls ban on growing Monsanto GMO maize
column5: PARIS France's highest court on Monday overturned France's ban on growing a strain of genetically modified maize (corn) developed by U.S. biotech firm Monsanto  saying it was not sufficiently justified.

column4: French court cancels ban on Monsanto GMO maize
column5: PARIS  Nov 28 France's highest court on Monday overturned a ban on the growth and use in France of a genetically modified (GM) maize developed by U.S. biotech company Monsanto  saying the farm ministry lacked the authority to impose the measure.

column4: UPDATE 2-Amazon says Kindle sales surge on Black Friday
column5: Nov 28 Amazon.com Inc said on Monday it saw a surge in sales of its Kindle devices  helped by its new Kindle Fire tablet  on the crucial "Black Friday" shopping day after Thanksgiving.

column4: Honda's North American plants to resume normal output
column5: Honda Motor Co said all of its North American plants will resume normal production by the start of next month  following improvement in overall parts supply  which was hit by the Thailand floods.

column4: Text-Fitch expects to rate Nat'l Fuel's '21 notes BBB+
column5: NEW YORK  November 28 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings expects to rate National Fuel Gas Company's (National Fuel) new $350 million senior unsecured notes due 2021 'BBB+'.     The new notes are to rank pari passu with the company's senior unsecured debt. Proceeds are to be used for general corporate purposes which include repaying $150 million of notes due in November 2011 and reducing short term debt. Fitch currently rates National Fuel as follows: --Long-term IDR 'BBB+'; --Senior unsecured debt 'BBB+'; -
